page.title: 03Agriculture,Ouse Valley
page.content: East of the R.Ouse are mixed farms (Little Gains,Great Oaks) with sheep, cattle and some arable.To the west,the area was 50% arable,50% pasture in 1945 now arable farming dominates.Snelson farm totals 1120 acres of which 114 acres are woodland,50 acres are floodable grassland and the rest is arable.Rape,3 Wheats and winter barley are grown in rotation with the application this year of Â£40,000 worth of herbicide and Â£100,000 compound fertilizer yielding:Rape-26 cwt per acre;winter barley-50 cwt per acre;winter wheat-70 cwt per acre.The farm employs 9 people with an additional 4/5 students at harvest time.It has 9 tractors and 1 crawler tractor,5 combine harvesters,2 grain driers and storage capacity for 23,000 tons of grain.Stubble is burnt.
